subject: Gardening
title: Svalbard Global Seed Vault
description: A micro-lesson that makes Svalbard Global Seed Vault usable.

hook.text: Deep inside an Arctic mountain in Norway, a vault holds over a million seed samples from every nation on Earth.

buildup.text: The Svalbard Global Seed Vault opened in 2008 as a backup for the world's 1,700 gene banks.

discovery.text: Permafrost keeps seeds frozen even without electricity. The vault can hold 4.5 million samplesâ€”capacity for all crops.

twist.text: In 2015, Syria made the first withdrawalâ€”retrieving seeds lost when its gene bank was destroyed by civil war.

climax.text: Svalbard is humanity's ultimate garden insuranceâ€”a frozen library of every crop we've ever domesticated.

punchline.text: The coldest place on Earth guards our food's future.

quiz.question: What event triggered the first seed withdrawal from the Svalbard Global Seed Vault?
options: A global wheat blight that threatened European crops
Syria's gene bank was destroyed during its civil war
A Norwegian research project on ancient grain varieties
